{{cpp/regex/match_results/title|prefix}}
{{cpp/regex/match_results/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|
const_reference prefix() const;
}}

Obtains a reference to the {{lc|std::sub_match}} object representing the target sequence between the start of the beginning of the target sequence and the start of the entire match of the regular expression.

{{cpp/precondition|{{rlpf|ready}} must be {{c|true}}.}}

===Return value===
Reference to the unmatched prefix.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;regex&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::regex re("a(a)*b");
    std::string target("baaaby");
    std::smatch sm;

    std::regex_search(target, sm, re);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; sm.prefix().str() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
b
}}
